Religion, Religious Experience and A Common Faith
9. Religion, Religious Experience and A Common Faith


The whole story of man shows that there are no objects that may not
deeply stir engrossing emotion. One of the few experiments in the
attachment of emotion to ends that mankind has not tried is that of
devotion, so intense as to be religious, to intelligence as a force in
social action. (A Common Faith,
1934a, LW9: 52–53)
